Food & Beverage Ball Flight Monitor Type of Range Targets: Flags Bunkers Built-up Greens 6 elevated target pitching nets PVC ground target hoops Instruction provided. Number of PGA Professional Instructors: 3 Clubfitting services provided. Total number of visits to range per year: 65,000 Number of range balls dispensed on range per year: 850,000 Number of range balls in inventory: 25,000 New balls are acquired: 5 times per year Best range promotion: Duran initiated Range membership bundles (Range and Par 3 membership) offering seasonal and annual programs for regulars and tourists. Programs include special rates for juniors and young executives. Our patrons have found great value in these memberships, and it has stimulated additional business at our facility. Many other monthly promotions are used, to include slower period buy one, get one, and promotions where juniors receive free product. WE also developed a partnership with a local new apartment complex, where all residents receive complimentary par 3 membership and free upgrade on range balls for a low monthly price! Special programs: Our PGA Professional Staff hosts two PGA Junior Golf Leagues per year, Middle School and High School Golf Leagues and Intramurals, {GA Drive. Chip, and Putt Qualifying Site, Host site of this years NJCAA Junior College National Golf Championship. Host of mens and womens college invitationals, . Duran also hosts complimentary clinics for local retirement community where they can either come to duran, or we go to visit their community. Duran hosts numerous charity golf fundraisers to assist locals raise money. Hole19 is the leading golf app for tracking scores, navigating courses with GPS precision, and unlocking performance insights. 4 Duran Golf Club (Par 3) Melbourne, FL, United States This course is mapped and available on Hole19 App Perfect for beginners and short game practice, Duran Golf Club Par 3 in Melbourne, Florida offers 9 scenic holes from 50 to 130 yards. Description The Duran Golf Club Par 3 Course in Florida offers a 9-hole layout perfect for golfers of all skill levels. Located in the heart of Melbourne, this charming course is ideal for a quick round, with holes ranging from 50 to 130 yards. The walkable design and compact layout make it particularly inviting for beginners, juniors, or anyone looking to fine-tune their short game. Nestled around the state-of-the-art practice range, the course showcases well-maintained greens and scenic surroundings. Golfers can also take advantage of Duran Golf Club's exceptional practice facilities, which include a full driving range, putting greens, and chipping areas. After your round, relax and refuel at the clubhouse, featuring a pro shop and a café with delicious menu options. Whether you're a local resident or visiting the vibrant Space Coast, the Duran Golf Club Par 3 Course is a must-play for a fun and affordable golf experience. Meet the Staff - Duran Golf Club (321) 504-7776 [email protected] Facebook X Instagram Facebook X Instagram Home Course Info Development Centre Development Center Development Center Membership Chipper’s Walk Development Center Rates Smash Golf Golf Tip of the Month Club Fitting and Repair Tournaments Course Layout Scorecard Rates Dress Code Memberships Signature Membership Crown Players Pass Loyalty Rewards Academy Academy of Golf Adult Programs Junior Programs Instructors Lesson Rates & Packages Book a Lesson AimPoint Green Reading Trackman Weddings & Events Weddings & Events Host Your Wedding Hosting a Banquet or Event Wedding Testimonials Audubon Int’l Audubon Int’l Course Notes Restaurant Reservations Menus Order Food Contact Contact Us E-Club Sign Up Meet the Staff Careers Shop Online Select Page Duran Golf Club Here to serve you Jeff Von Eschen, General Manager Jeff has been at Duran since July 2004, and has been involved in the project since the construction and grow-in. Prior to employment at Duran; Jeff spent 15 years at various clubs in Florida and New York. Jeff attended State University of New York in Morrisville where he studied horticulture and landscape architecture before locating to Florida in 1997. His duties include direction of the Management Team, overall operational and fiscal responsibility for the Duran Golf Club, and to develop and ensure the club standards of service that will assure maximum customer satisfaction. Should you have any questions or comments that pertain to the golf course maintenance operations please feel free to contact Jeff at (321) 504-7776, ext. 7412 or email him at [email protected] . Christy Helton, Club Operations Manager Christy Helton joined the Duran Staff in March 2012. Prior to Duran, Christy’s background includes marketing for the home building industry and sports marketing for NASCAR. Christy graduated from Salisbury State University in Salisbury, Maryland, with a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, and happily calls Viera her home. She is responsible for assisting Duran’s championship golf facilities and restaurant, along with the coordination of all the membership maintenance. You can contact Christy at (321) 504-7776, ext. 7314 or via email at [email protected] . Jeff Turner, Head Golf Professional Jeff can be contacted at (321) 504-7776, ext. 7340 or email at [email protected] . Justin Blazer, Director of Instruction Originally from Yorktown, Virginia, Justin Blazer developed an interest in teaching golfers through the development of his own game. While Justin’s golfing journey began as a teenager, it always took a backseat to other sports. As a standout basketball player through college, Justin’s competitive spirit was fueled once again when he started regularly joining his college golf team practices. This led to Justin’s interest in golf instruction and, backed by the same competitive spirit that drove him in sports, he eventually became a PGA Class A Teaching Professional. Today, as part of his journey in the golf industry, Justin actively plays in PGA sectional events, with a dream to qualify for the PGA Professional National Championship. Justin’s true passion, however, lies in working with juniors and the growth of junior golf. As Director of Instruction at the Duran Academy of Golf, Justin has established a breadth of junior programs for newcomers and competitive players. Many of his juniors have had tremendous success and currently compete at an elite level such as the U.S. Kids World Championships and other premier junior golf championships. This work has not gone unnoticed, as Justin has been awarded a two-time U.S. Kids Golf Top 50 Teacher, which recognizes the top junior golf instructors in the country. Justin can be reached at (321) 504-7776, ext. 7460 or email at [email protected] . Ryan Rozic, Lead Instructor Ryan can be reached at (321) 504-7776, ext. 7460 or email at [email protected] . Drew Norman, Superintendent Drew has been with Duran Golf Club since September 2004, being a part of the construction and grow in of the course. Graduating locally from Rockledge High School, Drew obtained his Associate of Arts degree from Brevard Community College while working on the course as 2nd Assistant Superintendent. In 2008, Drew graduated from the University of Florida with a Bachelor’s Degree in Sports Management, and a Minor in Business Administration. In 2011, after spending 3 years as the Sports Director for a local YMCA, Drew followed his love of golf back to Duran Golf Club and rejoined the Duran staff as 1st Assistant Superintendent. Drew has over 16 plus years of experience on a golf course. Drew’s responsibilities at Duran are all turf related, all native areas, common areas, as well as both clubhouses. Should you have any questions or comments that pertain to the golf course maintenance operations please feel free to contact Drew at Call Drew Norman at (321) 504-7776, ext. 7410 or email him at [email protected] . Nicole Latner, Food and Events Manager Nicole Latner joined the Duran Staff in February of 2020. Prior to Duran, Nicole’s background includes marketing and special event management at Urban Air Adventure Park. Nicole graduated from the University of North Florida in 2013 with a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing and International Business. After having lived in Jacksonville, FL for 9 years, she relocated back home to Viera with her husband and 3 children in 2017. Nicole will be responsible for marketing and coordinating all wedding, banquet and special events at Duran, as well as developing new relationships in the community. You can contact Nicole at (321) 504-7776, ext. 7300 or via email at [email protected] . Joy Gaskin, Chef (321) 504-7776, ext. 7371 or via email at [email protected] . John Madden, Development Center Lead John joined the staff at Duran in June 2020. He was born in New Fairfield, CT, and currently living in Bayside Lakes. He attended Melbourne High School and Brevard Community College, then played some tournaments on the Florida mini tour. He left golf and worked for Publix for 27 years as the meat manager but decided golf was his passion. He pursued a career in golf where he worked at a private club in Vero Beach, FL, prior coming to Duran. John is married with 4 kids and 3 grandkids. John is responsible for the daily activities at the Development Center. He also compled the Callaway University program gaining a certificate as a certified club fitter. He has hopes of joining the golf university program and gaining PGA status. You can contact John at (321) 504-7776, ext. 7470 or via email at [email protected] . Duran Golf Club 7032 Stadium Parkway Viera, FL 32940 (321) 504-7776 [email protected] Follow Follow Follow © Copyright Duran Golf Club Website by Lightspeed

			Duran Group Takes Over NGSA and GCH Global Edition News GOOD Directory Diary Golf Jobs About GBN.com Duran Group Takes Over NGSA and GCH 10.17am 5th January 2016	 - Corporate In a private transaction, the Duran Group has acquired the largest sales representative organization in the golf industry, the National Golf Sales Representatives Association (NGSA), together with Golf Clearing House. The NGSA has 3400 Sales Representative Members and over 400 Manufacturer Members. The organization was founded in 1987 by the late Tom Moynihan, who passed away in September 2015. “Over the past 27 years and 27 Orlando PGA Shows, I’ve always looked forward to seeing Tom Moynihan, and all of us who were touched by Tom will miss him dearly” stated Tony Duran, President and Founder of The Duran Group. “Over the past couple decades, Tom and I had many discussions on ways to improve the Sales Representative profession in the Golf Industry, and we are looking forward continuing with this important mission at a crucial time in the golf market.” Pamela Nichols, the sister of Tom Moynihan assumed control of the NGSA and GCH upon Tom’s passing, and her golf industry advisers strongly recommended The Duran Group for running the organization going forward. “We researched many options for continuing operations with the NGSA and GCH, and we selected The Duran Group to continue with Tom’s vision and lead the organization in the future,” she said. The NGSA will be in a meeting room (Room W107) at the upcoming 2016 PGA Merchandise Show , which is located one floor below the PGA Booth Exhibitor level near the PGA Educational Conferences. The 2016 Orlando PGA Show is from January 27th through January 29th, 2016 at the Orlando Convention Center. “We have considerable work ahead to improve the benefits for NGSA Members, and I look forward to receiving lots of feedback from Sales Representatives nationwide during the week of the show,” stated Tony Duran. The NGSA and GCH is based in Scottsdale, AZ. Headquartered in Orange County, CA, The Duran Group is the largest sales and marketing firm in golf. Developing and managing sales teams and executing marketing campaigns over the past 25 years, The Duran Group has been an integral part of the growth of over 50 golf companies, including the development of several new categories in golf such as plastic spikes, hybrid clubs, hand-held GPS, robotic bag carts and single rider standing electric golf carts. Instructors - Duran Golf Club (321) 504-7776 [email protected] Facebook X Instagram Facebook X Instagram Home Course Info Development Centre Development Center Development Center Membership Chipper’s Walk Development Center Rates Smash Golf Golf Tip of the Month Club Fitting and Repair Tournaments Course Layout Scorecard Rates Dress Code Memberships Signature Membership Crown Players Pass Loyalty Rewards Academy Academy of Golf Adult Programs Junior Programs Instructors Lesson Rates & Packages Book a Lesson AimPoint Green Reading Trackman Weddings & Events Weddings & Events Host Your Wedding Hosting a Banquet or Event Wedding Testimonials Audubon Int’l Audubon Int’l Course Notes Restaurant Reservations Menus Order Food Contact Contact Us E-Club Sign Up Meet the Staff Careers Shop Online Select Page Duran Golf Club Learn from the Best in Brevard The Duran Academy of Golf Instructional Staff at Duran Golf Club realize each and every golfer responds to different educational approaches. Our Golf Professional Staff will develop a curriculum tailored to each individual student, based on athleticism, current level of play, specific goals, and the time available to reach those goals. The staff at Duran believes in providing students with the understanding of Golf’s “fundamentals.” With that knowledge, students better understand relationships between grip, posture, alignment and swing motion. Justin Blazer - PGA, Director of Instruction Originally from Yorktown, Virginia, Justin Blazer developed an interest in teaching golfers through the development of his own game. While Justin’s golfing journey began as a teenager, it always took a backseat to other sports. As a standout basketball player through college, Justin’s competitive spirit was fueled once again when he started regularly joining his college golf team practices. This led to Justin’s interest in golf instruction and, backed by the same competitive spirit that drove him in sports, he eventually became a PGA Class A Teaching Professional. Today, as part of his journey in the golf industry, Justin actively plays in PGA sectional events, with a dream to qualify for the PGA Professional National Championship. Justin’s true passion, however, lies in working with juniors and the growth of junior golf. As Director of Instruction at the Duran Academy of Golf, Justin has established a breadth of junior programs for newcomers and competitive players. Many of his juniors have had tremendous success and currently compete at an elite level such as the U.S. Kids World Championships and other premier junior golf championships. This work has not gone unnoticed, as Justin has been awarded a two-time U.S. Kids Golf Top 50 Teacher, which recognizes the top junior golf instructors in the country. Justin has also worked with many LPGA and Senior Tour players as their putting and short game instructor, including Sir Nick Faldo. He has also caddied in multiple tour events and Q-schools for some of his students as a result of his expertise in green reading, tournament preparation and on-course strategy. Justin has appeared in instructional videos on Golfweek.com and FoxSports.com and other popular publications and blogs. He also serves as both a U.S. Kids Golf certified instructor specializing in teaching, fitting and competition for ages 6-12. Additionally, he is 1 of only 14 Aimpoint Certified Level 2 Instructors in the world, which enables Justin to teach students on the finer points of putting, including how to read greens and accurately predict break. Justin earned a degree in Recreation and Leisure Studies with a focus in Recreational Programming, Leadership and Coaching from Virginia Wesleyan College. Click here to book a private lesson. Ryan Rozic - Academy Instructor Ryan Rozic was born and raised in Melbourne, Florida.  Throughout his childhood, he played many sports including baseball, basketball, and golf.  However, Ryan’s main focus was on playing baseball and he would only play golf in the summertime with his dad. But when Ryan turned 14, he and his parents decided to fully pursue golf. But not long after this decision, Ryan fell in love with the game. As a junior golfer, Ryan played for Viera High School where he was a four-year varsity letterman. During his career, the Viera Hawks made two State championship appearances.  Outside of high school golf, Ryan played many local and state-wide junior events as he pursued his goal of being a college golfer. Ryan went on to play two years at Eastern Florida State College. In his time as a Titan, Ryan participated in two national championships.   He was named to the All-District team and a semi-finalist for the Jack Nicklaus Award his sophomore year. Ryan transferred to Trevecca Nazarene University and played three more years of college golf at the NCAA Division 2 level.  In his junior year, he won his first college event in a playoff at the Music City invitational and his team was the first team in school history to go to a national championship in the D2 era. In his final season, Ryan went on to win two events, one of which was the Great Midwest Athletic Conference Championship. Rozic has the 2nd lowest career average (72.84) in program history … his three career wins are fourth-most in school history … finished his career with 33 par-or-better rounds, second-most in school history … his 201 career birdies rank him fourth all-time. He graduated with a Bachelors degree in Accounting and earned his Masters in Business Administration with a concentration in Data Analytics. Following college, Ryan caddied for local tour pro and friend, Mickey DeMorat on the Korn Ferry Tour for the summer 2021 season and teammate, Blain Turner in the 2022 US Amateur.  Ryan has also worked as the assistant coach for the Men’s and Ladies Golf teams at Eastern Florida State College under his former college coach, Jamie Howell. While pursuing this opportunity, Ryan was assured that he wanted to be a golf instructor and help golfers achieve their personal goals. He is currently enrolled in the PGA Apprentice Program working to become a Class A PGA Professional. Click here to book a private lesson. Kyle DeCenzo - Academy Instructor Kyle DeCenzo was born in Framingham, Massachusetts and moved to Viera in 2007. He was a baseball player growing up until halfway through his freshman year of high school he decided to give golf a try. With six months until tryouts for the high school golf team, Kyle went on to take lessons and play in junior tournaments for the first time. While attending Viera High School, Kyle played for the golf team his sophomore through senior year and became a three-year varsity letterman. After graduating high school, Kyle started his college golf career at Eastern Florida State College. He played there from 2016 to 2018 earning All-Academic second team both years. After his two years at EFSC he then transferred to play golf for Florida Tech. During his time at Florida Tech, Kyle had a scoring average of 73.5, was a two-time Cleveland/Srixon All-American Scholar and got his bachelor’s degree in business administration. Towards the end of his senior season at Florida Tech, the remainder of the season got cancelled due to Covid, granting all college athletes that year to have an extra year of eligibility. After playing locally for high school and college golf, Kyle decided to take his eligibility to Delta State in Mississippi. During his final college golf season, Kyle averaged a 72.9 and got his MBA in General Business. Locally, Kyle is a 4-time winner of two local amateur tournaments. He won the Space Coast Amateur at Duran Golf Club in 2018 and 2021 and won the Platinum Coast at Rockledge Country Club in 2018 and 2020. During the Platinum Coast in 2020, Kyle shot career low tournament round 64. Professionally, Kyle has played in 13 OGA tour events since November 2022, has won two events and posted a 71.0 scoring average. Recently, he has enrolled in the PGA Apprentice Program and is working towards becoming a Class A PGA Professional. Being an academy instructor at Duran, his goal is to give back to the local golf community that has done so much for him over the past 10 years. Kyle will also continue to play in PGA section events and other professional tournaments. Click here to book a private lesson. Yes - every day. Season: Year round Characteristics The Duran Golf Club is a world class golf masterpiece located on Central Florida's East coast. This wonderful facility was designed by Florida Architect Lewis “Chip” Powell, and was opened in 2005. Constant coastal breezes, mild mounding, native grasses, and beautiful swaying palms will set the ambiance of an elegant course accented with link characteristics. Spreading out over 160 magnificently manicured acres with pristine lake views on 14 holes, this exceptional par 72 layout will feature five sets of tees and yardage ranging from 5,265 yards to a stout 7,151 yards. True putting tiff-eagle greens and large chipping areas will require golfers to utilize their skills and imagination for scoring opportunities. One of the most unique features of Duran Golf Club is the “State-of-the-Art” Development Center that offers an expansive practice range with teeing areas at both ends of the facility. A nine-hole “Par 3 Course” encircles the practice facility, which is perfect for all skill levels of golfers wanting to learn or develop their short game. Best of all, this facility is illuminated, allowing you to practice into the evening hours. Academy instructors are available year round for individual or group sessions. Adjacent to the state-of-the-art learning center is the clubhouse, featuring the Professional Golf Shop that offers a complete line of golf equipment to golf wear, and the Tradewinds restaurant, a full service dining facility with bar. This magnificent structure reflects the architecture and lifestyle of the British West Indies. Stepping onto the grounds will feel like taking a vacation to a wonderful tropical retreat. Duran Golf Club defines “Great Golfing Experience” to those who live for golf. Courses 18-Hole Duran Championship Course Opened in 2005. Design: Chip Powell . Style: Links.
